result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On/Near Multiunit Public Housing

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen C. Farina

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:15 pm - DA calls cases 14CF26, 27 and 28 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Allen C. Farina appeared.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE regarding right to atty.    DA files information, acknowleged and reading waived.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to 14CF27.  DE waives his right to preliminary hearing.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.   On motion of state, cases 14CF26 and 14CF28 are ordered dismissed but read in.

Court orders PSI.  Sentencing date to be set.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 13, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Request for Court Appointed Attorney - Denied

14CF26, 14CF27, 14CF28 - Defendant Allen C. Farina appeared.  Mark T Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaints acknowledged, reading waived.    DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.    Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue (one bond on all cases).
Request for court appointed attorney - denied
